DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the method used for freezing the sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation._The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase when the temperature is lowered.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for initial GDC new CDE request. mc 8/25/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A quantity having a value less than zero.: A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.: A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 0 degrees and the boiling point is 100 degrees at standard atmospheric pressure. The current official definition of the Celsius sets 0.01 C to be at the triple point of water and a degree to be 1/273.16 of the difference in temperature between the triple point of water and absolute zero. One degree Celsius represents the same temperature difference as one Kelvin.

Concepts.definition: A quantity having a value less than zero.
A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.

A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 0 degrees and the boiling point is 100 degrees at standard atmospheric pressure. The current official definition of the Celsius sets 0.01 C to be at the triple point of water and a degree to be 1/273.16 of the difference in temperature between the triple point of water and absolute zero. One degree Celsius represents the same temperature difference as one Kelvin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A quantity having a value less than zero.: A natural number greater than seventy-nine and less than eighty-one and the quantity that it denotes.: A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 0 degrees and the boiling point is 100 degrees at standard atmospheric pressure. The current official definition of the Celsius sets 0.01 C to be at the triple point of water and a degree to be 1/273.16 of the difference in temperature between the triple point of water and absolute zero. One degree Celsius represents the same temperature difference as one Kelvin.

Concepts.definition: A quantity having a value less than zero.
A natural number greater than seventy-nine and less than eighty-one and the quantity that it denotes.

A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 0 degrees and the boiling point is 100 degrees at standard atmospheric pressure. The current official definition of the Celsius sets 0.01 C to be at the triple point of water and a degree to be 1/273.16 of the difference in temperature between the triple point of water and absolute zero. One degree Celsius represents the same temperature difference as one Kelvin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.

Concepts.definition: A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to about -200 degrees Celsius.: A cryogenic process for the storage and/or shipping of biospecimens. The item to be frozen is placed above a shallow reservoir of cooling liquid in a storage vessel. A vertical temperature gradient is maintained throughout the vapor layer to ensure temperatures sufficiently low to maintain the integrity of the stored material.

Concepts.definition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to -196 degrees Celsius.

A cryogenic process for the storage and/or shipping of biospecimens. The item to be frozen is placed above a shallow reservoir of cooling liquid in a storage vessel. A vertical temperature gradient is maintained throughout the vapor layer to ensure temperatures sufficiently low to maintain the integrity of the stored material.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
